subject: Re: Recommended readings on more advanced (JUnit) testing

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Lasse Koskela <lasse.k=
oskela@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> On Wed, Feb 18, 2009 at 4:05 PM, majkic@...=
 <majkic@...> wrote:
> > Hi guys,
> > we're working on a big project with s=
everal frameworks:
> > Hibernate 3.3, Spring 2.5, Struts2.1, JUnit 4, Selen=
ium. We're using
> > Maven2, Hudson for CI etc.
> >
> > Is there any articl=
e/blog/book you could recommend for non-HelloWorld
> > , i.e. more complex =
- with aforementioned technologies JUnit/Selenium
> > examples/know-how?
> =
>
> > Thanks.
> 
> It's somewhat inconvenient to publish complex examples a=
s part of
> articles or books, which is why my first suggestion would be to=
 look
> for open source projects that make use of your chosen testing tools=
,
> check out their code base into your IDE, and browse those real world
> =
examples in an environment suitable for the "non-helloworld" level of
> com=
plexity.
> 
> Of course, you'll be missing on the narrative text that makes=
 books,
> articles and blog posts so convenient for getting started with a =
new
> technology but I take it that you're not exactly new to JUnit and
> S=
elenium since you're asking for complex examples.
> 
> Lasse
> 
> -- 
> Las=
se Koskela
